description: From Middle English *dogly, *doglich, equivalent dog +â€Ž -ly. Compare doglike.

adjectives.description: dogly (comparative more dogly, superlative most dogly)

entries.meaning: Of, like, or pertaining to dogs or the dog family; canine.
examples: I had a little dog who practiced all the dogly virtues. He never tried to get into any chairs or on any couches.

adverbs.description: dogly (comparative more dogly, superlative most dogly)

entries.meaning: In the manner of a dog.
